The Res-Net connection provides access to the Internet.       Quick Access            Access Res-Net             Contact Us          hide   AVAILABLE TO:  Students  FUNDED BY :  Res-Net Technology Access Fee       Answers  Features  More Info         Common Questions   Common Questions   How can I request help for IT or wireless problems in my dorm or residence hall?  How do I configure my Windows based laptop and desktop for Wired Res-Net and DHCP?  Which campus locations support wireless network access?  How do I configure Mac OS X for Wired Res-Net and DHCP?  More…   Other Resources   UIC Campus Housing Site  My Devices Portal           Features     Res-Net is available in all campus dorms including the following locations:    East campus  Commons South
Commons North
Commons West
Courtyard    West campus  Single Student Residence
Student Residence Hall
Polk Street Residence Hall    South Side  James J. Stukel Towers
Marie Robinson Hall
Thomas Beckham Hall              More Info   Applicability  Everyone using the UIC wireless networks must abide by the ACCC Acceptable Use Policy . There are additional bandwidth and file-sharing limitations on the networks, described in the Acceptable Use Policy for Res-Net and the UIC Public Wireless Networks.  Requirements  Res-Net service is automatically available to current UIC students or staff members residing in any of the campus residence halls and have a valid UIC NetID and common password.  Res-Net service is contingent upon acceptance and compliance with both the ACCC Acceptable Use Policy and the UIC Wireless and Res-Net Policy . Failure to abide by these policies will result in revocation of Res-Net service and/or use of ACCC account. Note in the UIC Wireless and Res-Net Policy the daily bandwidth limitation on Res-Net use (as well as the public wireless networks on campus).  Cost  Res-Net charges are part of the Campus Housing contract. Campus Housing charges residents a Technology Access fee which allows access to cable television, wired, and wireless internet connections in the residence halls. For pricing and further information, visit http://housing.uic.edu/internet .  Printing in Res-Net uses the same system and has the same charges as printing in the ACCC campus personal computer labs . For guest connections 5-10 business days depending on the availability of resident (to coordinate access to the space).
